It is characterized by its distinctive dark green to blackish leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically hidden within the rosette of leaves. It is native to the humid forests of South America, particularly in Brazil and Peru. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a threatened species in its natural environment.
